ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I was unable to attend lecture frequently because of a conflict with another of my classes, but I was happy that we had the flexibility to still participate in the clinic.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I liked being able to work with a different client in my second semester. My clients were very communicative and reasonable about the deliverable they wanted. I also appreciated having group members who were reliable and completed tasks in a timely manner.

Fantastic way to delve into a subject area not offered through other avenues at the University, to learn how to work in a team, and to work closely with an external client organization on a project with practical significance.
I got to work with amazing clients on a fulfilling project and go to a law conference.
Client interactions and the opportunity to work on real projects. The work is meaningful and rewarding. Experience navigating clients is also incredibly relevant.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Final presentations were very interesting but it's hard to stay focused when there are so many groups. Perhaps it'd be better to split the presentations up into two days, and allow for more questions.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: lot of team work

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: flexible to learn what I wish to learn
There are not a lot of courses dealing with my subject area, so I was excited to work with a client that focused on my interests.
Provided an excellent way to focus on marine / fisheries topics in a school that offers very little other opportunity to do so.
I'm a JD/MEM; this course is perhaps the most tailored class at Yale for someone in my program.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: interest
Opportunity to get more client work and gaining experience on policy analysis.
To work on fisheries projects
I was interested in gaining more hands-on experience.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: research
Yes! I learned quite a bit from the project I worked on and will (hopefully) be continuing to do similar work once I graduate.
Yes, absolutely. I learned a lot about working in a team, managing expectations, and a multitude of practical professional skills
This semester was fantastic. I learned more than I anticipated, and my internship this summer is directly related to my work in the clinic.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: My group was awesome! They were very reliable and completed everything on time. When one of us had an issue with timing/schedule, we were able to reschedule without a problem. Everyone made themselves available in-person and over email. We split up the tasks very equitably.
Advantages: we all complimented each other's knowledge and worked well together. Disadvantages: appropriately balancing workload and ownership of the work can be tricky.

The group was necessary to get through the high volume of work. My team was wonderful, but there were also some issues - but the issues weren't the fault of the course; dealing with that is just part of working with a team.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: pick a project that you will learn
Make sure you really enjoy the project you are working on and be very communicative with your client throughout the semester.
Absolutely take this course if you want the opportunity to work on a practical project that compliments other areas of your studies
EPC has been the most valuable thing I've done while at Yale. Take this clinic!

Look at the projects, and make sure you choose one that looks interesting to you. You may be able to talk to people who worked on the same project or with the same client in the past if you ask about it. The projects are diverse, so it's likely at least one will be a great fit for you.
